Authors: Suhartono D., Gazali W., Mamahit K.F.
Title: Analytic hierarchy process in detecting probability of online child grooming using neural network
Affiliations: Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University Jl. K., H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan,, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mathematics Department School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University Jl., K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan,, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Suhartono, D., Computer Science Department, Bina Nusantara University Jl. K., H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan,, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gazali, W., Mathematics Department School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University Jl., K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan,, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Mamahit, K.F., Mathematics Department School of Computer Science, Bina Nusantara University Jl., K. H. Syahdan No. 9, Kemanggisan,, Palmerah, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: The goal of this research is to detect probability of online child grooming by generating percentage score from online conversation. We applied 2 methods, one for classifying the conversation type and the other for calculating the online grooming percentage. We used neural network to classify the conversation into several classes. As for calculating the percentage, we used analytic hierarchy process (AHP) to find grooming score based on priority score for each class. This research focused more on online conversation that consists of two people and used English as the main language. The results can be used to determine whether the conversation is considered as groom or not. © 2019 ICIC International.
Author Keywords: Analytic hierarchy process; Neural network; Online child grooming; Online conversation; Priority score
